text.textblock: Tribal Consultation on Indian Education Topics Meeting; Notice
Tribal Consultation on Indian Education Topics

summary.textblock: Notice is hereby given that the Bureau of Indian Affairs (BIA) will conduct consultation meetings to obtain oral and written comments concerning potential issues in Indian education programs. The potential issues which will be set forth in a tribal consultation booklet to be issued prior to the meetings are as follows:
1. BIA safety and health inspection program_proposed rule.
2. BIA FY 95-97 State Plan_Exceptional Education Program.
3. Proposed Change to Intensive Residential Guidance Regulations.
4. Proposed National Organization for Higher Education Directors.
5. Proposed National Organization for Johnson-O'Malley Directors.
7. Indian Education Work Group Policy Papers.

date.textblock: March 14, 16, 18, 21, 23, and 25, 1994 for all locations listed. Several of the dates and locations were scheduled to coincide with meetings of various Indian education organizations. All meetings will begin at 9 a.m. and continue until 3 p.m. (local time). Written comments concerning the consultation items must be received no later than April 8, 1994.

address.textblock: Written comments should be mailed, to be received, on or before April 8, 1994, to the Bureau of Indian Affairs, Office of Indian Education Programs, MS 3512 MIB, 1849 C. Street, NW., Washington, DC 20240, Attn: Dr. John Tippeconnic; OR, may be hand delivered to room 3512 at the same address.

further.textblock: John Tippeconnic or Jim Martin at the above address or call 202/208-6123 or 208-3550.

supplem.textblock: The meetings are a follow-up to similar meetings conducted by the BIA since 1990. The purpose of the consultation, as required by 25 U.S.C. 2010(b), is to provide Indian tribes, school boards, parents, Indian organizations and other interested parties with an opportunity to comment on potential issues raised during previous consultation meetings or being considered by the BIA regarding Indian education programs. A consultation booklet for the March meetings is being distributed to Federally recognized Indian Tribes, Bureau Area and Agency Offices and Bureau-funded schools. The booklets will also be available from local contact persons and at each meeting.
